teal.math

Interface Integratable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MetaIntegratable, PhysicalElement
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ball, Circuit, Circuit.Battery, Circuit.Capacitor, Circuit.Component, Circuit.CustomResistor, Circuit.Resistor, CircuitParticleSystem, Coil, ConductingSphericalShell, ConstantField, CurrentSlab, CylindricalMagnet, Dipole, ElectricDipole, EMEngine, EMObject, EMRadiator, EnergyParticle, FiniteWire, HollowCurrentShell, InfiniteConductingPlane, InfiniteLineCharge, InfiniteWire, LineMagneticDipole, MagneticDipole, Particle, ParticleSystem, PhysicalObject, PointCharge, PointChargeConductingSphere, RigidBar, RingOfCurrent, Seafloor, SimEngine, SlidingBox, WeightedPhysicalPendulum

    public interface Integratable
    This interface should be implemented by TealObjects that need to have their properties updated via numerical integration.

    It assumes you have at least one property (a dependent variable) which changes with respect to another property (a single, independent variable). by implementing this interface you make information concerning the value of your dependent variables and their derivatives available via get/set methods. This information will be used by an integration scheme to update your dependent properties)
    This information will be used by an integration scheme to calculate new values of your dependent properties as your independent property changes.
    for example,
    a PointCharge that wants to update its position and velocity would implement this interface. The dependent properties would be position and velocity, the independent property would be time.
    When queried for getDependentValues, the PointCharge would return a double[] containing the x, y, and z components of its position and the x, y, z, components of its velocity.
    When queried for getDependentDerivatives, the PointCharge would return a double[] containing the values of the derivatives of the dependent variables, calculated using a set of values for your dependent variables and a value for your independent variable.
    When setDependentValues is invoked, the PointCharge would receive a double[] containing new values for its dependent variables. The order of the values in this array would match the order of the values returned by getDependentDerivatives .
    When queried for getIndependentValue, this PointCharge would return the current time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getDependentDerivatives(double[] depDerivatives, int offset, double indepValue)
      Return the values of the derivatives of your dependent variables, given a set of values for your dependent variables and a specific value of your independent variable.
      void getDependentValues(double[] depValues, int offset)
      Return the current values of your dependent variable(s) in an array of doubles.
      int getNumberDependentValues()
      Return the value of your independent variable as a double.
      boolean isIntegrating()
      Is this Integratable object actually responsible for contributing to the object to calculate the dynamic changes.
      void setDependentValues(double[] depValues, int offset)
      Given a double[], update the values of your dependent variables to the doubles contained within.
      void setIntegrating(boolean b)
      Sets if dynamic processing for this object is performed by the object.

    • Method Detail

      • getDependentValues

        void getDependentValues(double[] depValues,
                        int offset)
        Return the current values of your dependent variable(s) in an array of doubles.

      • getDependentDerivatives

        void getDependentDerivatives(double[] depDerivatives,
                             int offset,
                             double indepValue)
        Return the values of the derivatives of your dependent variables, given a set of values for your dependent variables and a specific value of your independent variable. depValues double[] containing values of your dependent variables that you should use to calculate values of dependent derivatives
        Parameters:
        indepValue - double holding the value of the independent variable that you should use to calculate values of dependent derivatives.

      • setDependentValues

        void setDependentValues(double[] depValues,
                        int offset)
        Given a double[], update the values of your dependent variables to the doubles contained within. These doubles will be in the same order returned by getDependentValues. newDepValues a double[] to which you set the values of your dependent variables.

      • getNumberDependentValues

        int getNumberDependentValues()
        Return the value of your independent variable as a double.
        Returns:
        The independent value your dependent variables are changing with.

      • isIntegrating

        boolean isIntegrating()
        Is this Integratable object actually responsible for contributing to the object to calculate the dynamic changes.

      • setIntegrating

        void setIntegrating(boolean b)
        Sets if dynamic processing for this object is performed by the object.
